crypto

Class ChaosImageEncrypt

  • java.lang.Object
    • crypto.ChaosImageEncrypt

  • public class ChaosImageEncrypt
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is an implementation of the paper Image encryption using chaotic logistic map (Published 2006) by - N.K. Pareek , Vinod Patidar , K.K. Sud. This class is used to encrypt an image, preferably lossless compressed image, by using Picard Iteration of Logistic map. It encrypts individual pixel's RGB value.
    Since:
    February-2017
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Prince Rachit Sinha

      • calculateXY0

        public static float calculateXY0(float X01,
                                 float X02)
        This method finds the value of ( X01+X02 )mod 1.
        Parameters:
        X01 - First real number
        X02 - Second real number
        Returns:
        floating point number less than 1.0

        Parameters:

      • isValidKey

        private static boolean isValidKey(java.lang.String key)
        This method is used to validate the ASCII key by the user. The key should be of length 10.
        Parameters:
        key - A String given by the user
        Returns:
        True if the key is valid, false otherwise.

      • logisticIteration

        public static float logisticIteration(float I)
        An implementation of Logistic Map Picard Iteration which is xn = xn-1*r*(1-xn-1). Here r is taken as 3.999999999999999 for maximum chaotic nature.
        Parameters:
        I - A floating point number as xn-1 to calculate the nth iteration.
        Returns:
        A float after one iteration.

      • writeRGB

        public static int writeRGB(int alpha,
                           int R,
                           int G,
                           int B)
        Merge the Red, Green, Apha and Blue bits and return it as one integer.
        Parameters:
        alpha - The alpha value of the pixel
        R - The red value of the pixel
        G - The green value of the pixel
        B - The blue value of the pixel
        Returns:
        Returns the equivalent ARGB pixel value of the passed params

      • byteXOR

        public int byteXOR(int rgb,
                   int group)
        Performs XOR operation as: R with keyArr[3] , G with keyArr[4] and B with keyArr[5] if the group number is 2. Performs XOR operation as: R with keyArr[6] , G with keyArr[7] and B with keyArr[8] if the group number is 5.
        Parameters:
        rgb - The argb value of the pixel.
        group - The group number
        Returns:
        An argb(int) after XOR operation

      • calculateX02

        public void calculateX02(int start,
                         int end)
        Calculates the sum of hexaKeys in the give range and then divides it by 96. It stores the calculated value in the static X02.
        Parameters:
        start - The start index to run the summation loop.
        end - The end index.

      • calculateXY01

        public float calculateXY01(char[] B)
        Calculates the X01 or Y01 according to the formula (BX2)10/224.
        Parameters:
        B - An array of characters (bits)

        public void calculateY02()
        Calculates Y02 using the formula:

      • complexOper

        public int complexOper(int rgb,
                       int type,
                       int groupno)
        Performs the operation :
        Parameters:
        rgb - The argb value of the pixel
        type - Operation type i.e. encryption/decryption
        groupno - The group number of operation.
        Returns:
        An argb value as int.

      • createB

        public char[] createB(char i,
                      char j,
                      char k)
        Creates B1 or B2. This method converts the 3 session keys into binary array of characters.
        Parameters:
        i - Value of session key #1
        j - Value of session key #2
        k - Value of session key #3
        Returns:
        A character array of bits.

      • encryptImage

        public boolean encryptImage(java.lang.String key,
                            java.awt.image.BufferedImage img,
                            int enctype,
                            java.lang.String output)
                     throws InvalidKeyException,
                            java.io.IOException
        This function is the sole function the user is expected to call when using this algorithm to encrypt the image.
        Parameters:
        key - The ASCII key string of length 10
        img - An object of BufferedImage to be encrypted/decrypted.
        enctype - Type pf operation i.e. encryption(0) or decryption(1)
        output - enc/dec image name.
        Returns:
        A boolean value showing the status of operation. True for success and false for failure.
        Throws:
        InvalidKeyException
        java.io.IOException

        public void generateIntegerSequence()
        Generates a sequence of random integer in [0,24] and stores them into P.

        Generates a sequence of random real nums in between 0 and 0.9 and stores them into f.

        public int invertColor(int rgb)
        Inverts the rgb value of pixel.
        Parameters:
        rgb - The argb value of the pixel
        Returns:
        An integer equivalent of negative of pixel(rgb only)

      • iterateY

        public void iterateY()
        Method used to iterate Y0 (key[10])10 times. (Indexing assumed to be from 1.)

      • modifySessionKey

        public void modifySessionKey()
        This method is called after operation on 16 pixel. It modifies the Session keys and then calls setHexaKey.

      • notByteXOR

        public int notByteXOR(int rgb,
                      int type,
                      int groupno)
        Performs the operation:
        Parameters:
        rgb - The argb of pixel
        type - The type of operation viz. encryption(0) or decryption(1)
        groupno - The group number of the operation
        Returns:
        An integer equivalent of pixel after performing the operation

      • operation

        public int operation(int type,
                     int rgb,
                     float Y0)
        This function acts as a map to function. It takes a value between 0 and 1 and calls the appropriate operation.
        Parameters:
        type - The type of operation viz. encryption(0) or decryption(1)
        rgb - The argb of pixel
        Y0 - The value which decides the operation
        Returns:
        Modified argb value in the form of an integer.

      • setHexaKey

        public void setHexaKey()
        Converts the ASCII representaion of key into an array character of hexadecimal values.
